channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024050537
item.description:
Report E-2024050537

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-24T15:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-20
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 15ft-by-180ft area of the asphalt lot and 8ft-by-8ft area of the concrete dock floor and estimated that forty (40) gallons of material was released from one (1) damaged 250-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel deployed a neutralizer and granular absorbents to the impacted areas. The spent materials were recovered and containerized into four (4) 55-gallon poly drums. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new poly tote. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024051171
item.description:
Report X-2024051171

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-23T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release during sort operations at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained a single metal can that was dented on the side causing the lid to open. the shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024050845
item.description:
Report X-2024050845

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-22T15:12:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-14
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered at the MEMH facility. The fiberboard box contained nine glass bottles and one of broke spill it's contents inside of the box. Three of the bottles were wrapped with absorbent material and inside of barrier bags the rest were separated by fiberboard dividers. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.
